Talk_07:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Sad>I know that stables need a <clr:0000>storage space
for building materials<clr:ffff>, but it's taking ages
to get it in order.
I hope I can get back to looking after
horses or taking care of customers soon.
Talk_08:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Sad>All I do is clean the<clr:0000> building material
storage<clr:ffff> and trash-disposal area...

This isn't why I wanted to work at a
stable. I hope I can go back to taking
care of horses or something soon.
Near_05: I'd be happier as a guide...
Talk_09:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>Of course, of course. Directions are
important, after all. I'm happy to go over
them as many times as you need.
Near_08: This is bad, this is bad!
Talk_22:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Ahh, I'm finally back to doing the work
I enjoy.

But don't worry. My humble guiding
services are still available. Is there
anything I can help you with?
Talk_23:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Sleep>Enough...cleaning. Let me work...with horses...
If you're looking...for a guide...I'm...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_13:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>I'm taking a little break. Just, uh, please
don't tell my boss.
Talk_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Things are a bit of a mess around here.
If you need to use the stable, you can
check in at the counter.
<sp:3:0:2:0101>Oh! But if you have questions about
routes through the area, then I'm the
guide for you!
If you're passing through here, then you
must be heading to <clr:0000>Gerudo Town<clr:ffff>, right?

Allow me to offer information about my
<clr:0000>regional recommendations<clr:ffff>, free of charge!
Talk_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy>Ah, it looks like you're interested in my
guide services!

Are you headed to <clr:0000>Gerudo Town<clr:ffff>? Or do
you want information about my carefully
curated <clr:0000>regional recommendations<clr:ffff>?
Talk_03:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy>If it's Gerudo Town you want, then the
safest route is to cross <clr:0000>Digdogg Bridge<clr:ffff>.

To get there, head right when you leave
the stable, then take another right at the
three-way intersection.
A <clr:0000>massive Zonai ruin<clr:ffff> fell near the bridge.
That place is swarming with researchers.
You can't miss it.
Talk_16:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Whew! I'm worn out. And you've been
working hard, too, mister!
Talk_17:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Phew. I'm finally done for the day. My
back is killing me after all that cleaning...

<sp:3:0:2:0801>But if you're looking for my guiding
services, then I'm fresh as can be! 

Are you headed to <clr:0000>Gerudo Town<clr:ffff>? Or do
you want information about my carefully
curated <clr:0000>regional recommendations<clr:ffff>?
Talk_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Well, you'll have to get through the desert
to reach Gerudo Town.

I've heard an enormous <clr:0000>sand shroud<clr:ffff> has
blown in and they're locked down tight.
Talk_05:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:QuestionNormal>Well then! Have you heard about the
<clr:0000>Coliseum Ruins<clr:ffff>?

To get to those ruins, first face directly
away from the front of the stable.

Then take a look to the mountain that's
somewhat off to your right. You'll find the
ruins by crossing over it.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>When you stand right in the middle of
the strange, circular ruins and close
your eyes, something happens.
You can hear the battle cry of those
powerful soldiers testing their strength
long, long ago.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Hearing that, you can't help feeling a
rush of adventure! I highly recommend
going to those ruins.<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>Be warnedâ€”a truly vicious monster has
settled there.

You'll probably end up testing YOUR
strength against it.
Talk_18:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:QuestionSurprise_00>Yikes! Rain! Ooh, I sure hope we don't get
any <clr:0000>lightning<clr:ffff>...

Ugh. I'm going somewhere dry.
Talk_19:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Drat, it's raining! You should get out of
the rain, too, traveler.
